meta.hint: Reflexive pronouns are pronouns that end in -self or -selves. Subject (singular)        Reflexive pronoun             I                                myself           you                            yourself           she                             herself            he                              himself             it                                 itself  Subject (plural)           Reflexive pronoun         we                             ourselves         you                            yourselves         they                           themselves  Reflexive pronouns are used to refer back to the subject of a sentence. They should  match the subject. Example - We helped ourselves to some more soup. The subject of the sentence is we, so use ourselves.  Example - Amy drives herself to work every morning. The subject of the sentence, Amy, can be called she, so use herself.  A reflexive pronoun can only be used to refer to the subject. To refer to someone else or  something else, a personal pronoun, like me, you, him, her, it, us or them, should be  used instead. Example - Jake wrote a note for himself. The reflexive pronoun, himself, refers back to the subject, Jake.  Example -Jake wrote a note for him. The personal pronoun, him, must refer to someone other than the subject, Jake.
meta.question: Select the best pronoun to complete the sentence.
